course_title: Spec Topics: Women, Gender, & Sexuality Studies: Women of Color Feminisms
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 18 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: (This course examines the history of minority women's theorizing and organizing in America since 1851. We will engage the theoretical scholarship of Black, Asian American, Latina/Chicana, and Native feminists, and interrogate contemporary social movements that advance the diverse goals of feminist equality. The class will cover contemporary issues of reproductive justice, environmental inequality, technological and digital inequality, structural and social power, and more. This course is designed for students in Women's, Gender, and Sexuality Studies, Sociology, Ethnic Studies, History, Philosophy, and related fields.)
